review_title: Think twice before joining this company!
pros: Benifits are ok and the pay was acceptible if you do not take into account all the extra hours you are expected to put in .
cons: The company shows zero appreciation to their employees or unless you are the select few. They will totally take advantage of you and try to work you to death with no additional compenstation. They care more about the accuracy of the their processes vs getting the job done. Please make sure you read all the policies as they refuesed to pay me for 71 hours of vacation that I earned with the company when I left because I was not in a state that required them to. I hope the management enjoyed bonus of my $4000+ vacation money that I earned. Expect to use your own computer equipment and cell phone and to be called at all hours of the night with the threat of disciplinary action if you dont respond in 10 minutes. This is by far the worse people company I have ever worked for. They will not hire enough people to do the work required and thus they use level 3 Network Engineering staff to act as the helpdesk on weekends when you have your mandatory oncall rotation.

review_title: Ignore the previous company posts like “Great Company” these are just fake contributions from NTT.
pros: Not a lot of Pros.
cons:
Do not come here if you are looking for a career. Everything in the company is designed to turn people over as soon as their project is done. Employees use their own laptops and work from a cloud environment which enables NTT to just turn off an account at will. 

No annual raises. None! Raises are only given if you are promoted, (less than 1% of staff). 

401k match vests in 5 years. So since very few people make 5 years they never pay vesting. 

Taking vacation is frowned upon because it impacts your bill-ability metric and if you leave you are not paid for any vacation. 

They recently promoted and are watching social media used by their employees. Giving them credit when they post or like something on Linked in or posted a positive comment on Glassdoor. 
They are doing this because they realize how bad they treat their employees and rather than fix it they just want to try to cover it up. 

Lastly, their new focus is hiring college grads. Why, because they can get them cheap and they usually don’t know the difference between a good or bad company. 

STAY AWAY from this company.

pros:
Sales pay is market avg 
Large client portfolio
Decent tools
cons:
Terrible sales leadership, I mean horrendous. Nothing more than salesforce admins. 0 client or industry knowledge just strictly spread sheet robots who refer to themselves at sales “coaches”.  These robots have jester admin robots who do and repeat the same information. These sales managers are a huge reason for high attrition, when you provide 0 value but demand hours a week for 50 person pipeline calls it’s an exhaustive process that takes valuable time away from clients and selling motions.
Terribly slow and arduous internal validation of deals. No quick sow delivery with sometimes up to 3 internal deal reviews before a sow can be delivered all requiring large decks to present the deal to executives. Absolute waste of time and frustrates customers looking for speed of execution. 
No substantial value prop, this organization has no defining value prop over competition. It’s a relationship sales org only so best hope you get lucky with assignment. Then after you sell cross your fingers you can actually deliver the work… 
This place is a one way ticket back to Glassdoor or some  other job search in 2 years. Id suggest somewhere with real leadership who drives value in addition to a portfolio that can actually be sold and/or delivered successfully.  My advice stay away..

pros:
1- They will sponsor your Visa
2- They will provide you the opportunity to switch projects if you are billed to a client
3-They will reimburse certification fee for any internal or external trainings you might take
4-They will provide you relocation assistance
5-They will provide yearly performance bonus
cons:
1-Visa sponsorship will only be approved IF you have 3 years left on your H1B and god willing your manager approves your application on time to get processed via HR
2- If an employee is interested in moving to a new project then they can do so via their network within NTT or directly to thier practise manager. Unless you are being relieved from your current project, then you only have 2 weeks to find new project within other NTT Projects and HR will as easily cut you off like an unused arm without second thought
3- Internal/External certification training will be reimubrsed only on a signed document that if you leave the company within next 1 yr, you will have to pay the company back . And good luck convincing your manager or delivery director convincing that you need certain certification for your skill enhancement because the first question they ask is write down why you need this certification and how it will help you perform your current duties.
4- relocation assistance will be provided based on distance and whether you have dependents or not, with a set amount, tax deducted, which will be of no use when it lands on your bank account and with a condition that if you leave the company in next one year you will have to pay the money back , orcourse the amount before tax deduction
5- yearly bonus will be slightly 2% or even less and that too disbursed to you after 6 months of end of Q3

review_title: NTT DATA - not an employer of choice
pros:
1) NTT has a few good people working for them. 
2) They have high aspirations but get lost in achieving
cons:
1) Management accountability is inconsistent. 
2) Bonus' are part of compensation package but actually seeing a bonus a pipe dream 
3) Performance reviews are stacked against a predefined % of people that must be identified as low performers regardless of whether or not it's deserved or justified. 
4) Constantly looking to cut headcount to increase revenue regardless of impact to customer and contractual agreements on service/support 
5) NTT Data struggles to value its people until they give notice to leave - then they are surprised when someone leaves.
6) Compensation is not market competitive

Recently they have made some really good improvements on the learning platforms and so there are tons of resources now to improve your skills. Project to Project movement is also a smooth process. No Onsite opportunity either

2. The above thing happened to me, and despite requesting plethora of times with the management, there was no consideration. There are just not bothered about the career trajectory.
3. Politics, A whole bunch of people keep recruiting their likes and given preferences blatantly. No matter what you do.
4. Culture, Worst culture I have ever come across, HR's in this company are good for nothing! I repeat - Good for nothing. 
5. Salary and Compensation, There is a bonus they provide at the end. And if you are a "Bucket" person, you might end up getting a reasonable amount.
6. Career Growth, I was recruited for being an engineer and trained on cloud technologies. But, was given a role to allocate laptops to other teams, and install OS and other softwares. No justification whatsoever to the training I was given or my degree. I slogged there for 2 years hoping to get a change, which never happened. Hope this gives a fair idea about career growth @ NTT.

review_title: Money is not everything, I can't stay anymore in such a toxic environment
pros:
Salaries are good, not the highest on the market, but generous and paid on time. 
There are many people in the company who are very skilled in their profession, passionate about technology and innovation, striving to do beautiful things, and sharing their knowledge with others. Too bad they don't run teams, departments, or the company.
cons:
This company is a toxic environment, poisoned right from the top of the Romanian leadership. It's all about money and power, greed and aggression. You have to accept any abuse of bosses or customers, to work as they impose on you, your opinion and experience do not matter.
All meetings are just talking about projects, priorities, revenues, profit, performance, and efforts only.  Customers are deified, and we are not listened to. I came here to do technology and learn to be better in the profession, but I only do execution, military obedience, being told that whoever has the money dictates on all topics.
I did not expect such a climate, in a Japanese company. I thought that the Japanese believe in respect and honor. Seeing the way the leaders in Romania are publicly manifesting themselves, my family constantly asks me if I have not been approached for intimate relationships, other than strictly professional ones. It didn't happen to me, but I have colleagues who told me they went through this.
It is not normal anywhere in the world for the promotion of people in the company to be done on the basis of obedience to the orders or pleasures of the great boss. It is not normal for top management to consist of incompetent people, who have arrived there through kinship, friends, intimate favors, or lucky marriages with the same repulsive character who makes all the decisions and behaves like the company is still his estate, although it no longer is. Maybe the Japanese leadership will finally decide to do a little cleaning and disinfection at the Romanian branch.

pros: Nice offices, good social culture (pre-covid) amongst younger members of staff, charge rates and hence client expectations are low you rarely need to work unsociable hours if you a competent
cons:
Where to begin....
- very opaque annual and promotion review process. Rules seem to change without warning and to suit whoever senior management flavour of the month is
- Distinct, closed-shop inner circle around members of senior management within consulting, who then receive favorable projects and internal opportunities 
- Roles on offer are very poor - strategic and/or advisory consulting is non-existent, expect to be a bodyshopped PM or BA and left alone with no support for 6/12 months at a time
- Bullying and gaslighting not uncommon from certain directors. Expect HR to ignore any complaints 
- LOTS of nepotism - not insignificant amount of junior members of staff are children of senior management or their friends. While some are competent and hard working, others are not so expect to have to cover for their shortcomings if they work with you
- Salary increases, even with promotion, are laughably bad

review_title: Decent benefits and good to start your career
pros:
Good to start your career and learn on the job. Easy to get into and depending 
 on the role and client you're set for life with decent job security especially with US clients where you're nearshore with lower rates compared to US employees. The benefits are OK .
cons:
Lack of mentoring and focus on you as an individual. All the emphasis is to get you worked on project and bill the client. The first company in my career to copy paste the same Performance goals for the entire team rather than having a meaningful conversation with the employee on their career interests. However experiences are based on individual projects and although NTT is put forward as 1 brand it constitutes of multiple small companies acquired over a period of time but still has their own individual culture. My experience in Canadian client projects were better than US client projects. 
Horrible onboarding. I understand that when I was hired late last year in mid of COVID meant less face to face time but there wasn't even basic onboarding help or touchpoints to understand if I was equipped with what I needed. There was only 1 hour HR meeting to talk through benefits however nothing around client onboarding or at least basic touchpoints. You are let alone to swim in the waters. My manager always cancelled my touchpoint calls stating he was busy and whenever he attended the calls he was on the run to wrap it up in couple of minutes thus making you feel like just a billable body. However as mentioned, if you're looking for job security and ok with a stagnant career, this is your place

pros: A culture of teamwork and participation. Excellent leadership from the CEO, Bob Pryor! For example, they gave a lot of support to North Texas Food Bank. Volunteering was so much fun and it built comradery among the employees. Their diversity program was developing and getting stronger every day. There were a number of ERGs (Employee Resource Groups) - one for climate, one for veterans, one for support of black people. This was a really wonderful part of NTT DATA. The company was very protective of all the employees during COVID19. People tend to stay employed there, which says a lot about the company too.
cons: Would like to work there again!
